### ERROR TIPS

#### Errors when connecting entities with pipes without valid connections
- Ensure that the source and target entities have valid connection points and that there are no obstacles blocking the connection.

#### Errors when placing entities at a position occupied by another entity
- Ensure that the target position is not occupied by another entity before attempting to place an entity.

#### Errors when placing pipes at a position occupied by another entity
- Ensure that the target position is not occupied by another entity before attempting to place a pipe.

#### Errors when attempting to place an entity without required items in inventory
- Ensure that you have the required items in your inventory before attempting to place an entity.

#### Errors when entities are not connected to power network
- Ensure that the entities are properly connected to a power source and that the power network is functioning correctly.

#### Errors when entities have no input liquid or fluid present in connections
- Ensure that the entities are properly connected to the required fluid sources.

#### Errors when using undefined variables
- Ensure that all variables are defined before using them in your code.

#### Errors when attempting to get an entity that does not exist
- Ensure that the entity exists at the specified position before attempting to get it.

#### Errors when attempting to place an entity next to another entity with insufficient spacing
- Ensure that there is sufficient spacing between entities when placing them next to each other.

#### Errors when connecting transport belts directly from a chest
- Use an inserter to take items from the chest and then connect the transport belt to the inserter.

#### Errors when attempting to connect to an inserter's drop position that is occupied
- Ensure that the drop position of the inserter is not occupied by another entity.

#### Errors when attempting to place an entity at a position that is too far away
- Move closer to the target position before attempting to place an entity.

#### Errors when passing incorrect argument types to functions
- Ensure that the arguments passed to functions are of the correct type.

#### Errors when attempting to insert items into an inserter that is not accepting the item or has no available space
- Ensure that the inserter is able to accept the item and has available space before attempting to insert.

#### Errors when attempting to access attributes of an entity that do not exist
- Ensure that the attribute exists for the entity before attempting to access it.

#### Errors when extracting items from an empty container
